website_summaries.verdict: Power-saving design that's also slim, meaning this is a good SSD to place inside a laptop.
pros: Will give you the option of storage capacities between 250 GB and 2 TB
Strong read/write speeds up to 560 MB per second
Ships with a five-year limited warranty
Delivers a good price per GB
Draws about 25% less power than previous WD internal SSDs
cons: Some problems with quality control issues on occasion

customer_reviews.title: Good drive. Not the fastest .
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drive. It works as promised. I won't add performance test results because there are plenty online. I work mostly with Java/Android/iOS projects and all works as expected. I did not notice any performance difference with my MacBook NVMe drive when doing real work. Happy with the unit. It might not last as a Samsung 8xx but I am not expecting to use the full lifespan of the unit. I recommend it if you want to save some money. Quite honestly, any ssd from a reputable brand is OK nowdays. I might look for something better if you were doing rendering or you need and Extreme workstation performance. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Good but has problems
customer_reviews.text: The SSD is brilliant. WD always makes good drives. Unfortunately if your using this in a laptop as an upgrade then using the Acronis cloning software is going to be a huge problem. it wont recognise the SSD and tells you to buy the full version. So unless your laptop drive is a WD one your going to have problems. The way around it is to use your desktop computer if it has any type of WD drive in it and then the software works fine. If not forget it. There are other SSD's out there that are just as good and the cloning software is better.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Acronis True Image WD Edition (Cloning software) didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The cloning software which WD recommend is a disaster. Three hours trying to get it to run on my laptop and it just wouldn't run no matter what I tried. Eventually, I gave up and downloaded the free version of EaseUS. Followed the simple instructions and it cloned my new SSD perfectly. Total time to clone was about three hours (using a SSD USB 3.0 cable) after which I simply shut down my laptop, removed the original 500GB HDD and inserted the cloned WD SSD. Bingo! Laptop booted up immediately from my new drive. ps Two days later and I'm still waiting on (a now redundant) response from Western Digital tech support.....
customer_reviews.author: Eamon A Blaney

customer_reviews.title: Broken Drive, keeps freezing and disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it was going to be good as an external drive for my Xbox, replacing my 250GB Samsung ssd, I used the same usb caddy (and tested another) but after about 20 mins of playing a game on that drive, the game will freeze up, and nothing else will load from it until it's been disconnected and reconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Astles

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value SSD
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality solid state drive. Standard holes to fit into standard mount plate and so very easy to install. No screws are supplied, so you have to provide your own. If you're upgrading an existing SSD this won't be a problem. If you're upgrading to the 500GB from a smaller drive, I recommend using Clonezilla to duplicate your existing disk. You can let the Clonezilla resize partitions to take advantage of the new disk size. In in easy 30 minute process, I now have 300G extra SSD! Nice! I paid around £50 for a 500GB drive from a reputable manufacturer. That seems good value to me.
customer_reviews.author: wingers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to upgrade my daughter's oldish laptop, that had been lagging for some time. Using third party cloning software, I transferred her existing system on to this drive and the difference in speed was astounding. Start up times decreased dramatically and the whole machine was just faster in general. Besides the speed increase, increasing from 250 to 500 gig was a huge bonus, so for the price, this was a very worthwhile upgrade and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: G Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 weeks of light use
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to speed up the spare computer in the back room because it was cheaper than a Samsung (which have never let me down). But it failed after just 6 weeks of occasional use. Attempts to reinstall Windows failed. And attempting to (re)format the drive using Disk Manager results in error message "The request could not be performed because of an I/O device error". Tried it in different ports with different cables. Same result. Wish I'd paid a bit more and stuck with Samsung now. Sadly it seems WD SSD's are as unreliable as their mechanical counterparts :(
customer_reviews.author: Grim Git

customer_reviews.title: Superb upgrade to give tired PC's a new lease of life
customer_reviews.text: I've used WD for years on numerous rigs and always been pleased with performance reliability, Their SDD line is no exception. The Blue is there mid tier drive. Reliable but not the best performance. I've installed this into a 3 year old laptop and the performance boost is significant as you would expect going from a mechanical drive. These are also ideal as storage drives and main drives if you don't do anything demanding. If you're looking for performance I'd recommend their Black series SDD or paying a bit extra for Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cruze

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My last hard drive was on its way out and I was convinced to buy an SSD and will never look back again. The speed when turning my Lenovo i7 laptop both on and off is amazingly fast, along with everything else on my laptop. I had my friend install it for me and she did it fairly quickly. I probably could have done it myself though you have to get some kind of settings in the bios for it to work, so do remember that. I had windows pro installed and now feels like I have a brand new laptop. Overall, the performance of my laptop has improved greatly.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Don't think too much about buying one, it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason these have got such great reviews, whether this brand (WD) or others. They really breathe new life into an old pc. The old spinning disk drives are the bottleneck of most computers as they're really the only moving part. The CPU and RAM are hundreds of times quicker than the old spinning disks which means you change the disk drive first. Windows or any other system loads in about 15 sec instead of 40, programs open up 3 to 5 times quicker. Totally worth the £50 or so if you can afford it, especially if you use your pc a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ChilledPill

customer_reviews.title: Fried in a month.
customer_reviews.text: Fried itself within a month. Replaced the data cable with that which came with my power supply. Plugged into the right ports when I hear a small pop starting my pc. Never recognised the ssd after that and now it's a light little paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: idk

customer_reviews.title: "But it's only 500 mb/s", yes and that is all you'll ever need
customer_reviews.text: This is a great SSD, it is under rated! I got it because some games take ages to load and I decided, huh this must be due to my HDD. So I upgraded to this and load into games instantly now! It's so easy to install as are all SSD's, just slap in the cables, boot up PC and you can set it up like any storage drive. This is an amazing product for the price, and honestly you don't need a faster write read speed, my Windows 10 install loads in about 8 seconds, so think of that before you go looking for other drives.
customer_reviews.author: kieranb

customer_reviews.title: Great value SSD.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade the harddrive of my wife's aging Lenovo Ideapad, which only had sata support. Along with a slight increase to the amount of installed ram, this update has drastically enhanced the performance of the laptop. Easy to fit, low cost per GB, low power, relatively fast read and write speeds. There's really nothing not to like about this product. Great as a primary OS drive or for additional storage in a laptop or PC.
customer_reviews.author: K. King

customer_reviews.title: I have a few of these as I clone Hard drives so that if one fails I can just jump back in time
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, I clone once a month so that I can step back in time if a drive fails, so do a 3 clone cycle. SSDs are very quick to Boot up which is good. Also can take a bit more of a hammering during shipping than normal HDDs , so if you happen to have a carzed delivery person it can survive. In the past had to return HDDs beacause the box had taken such a hammering in transit. Mind you The Amazon network seems good nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Shutter

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: This will Transform an ageing laptop. Press Ctrl Alt Delete and get task manager up on your screen, if hard drive usage in performance tab is high or very high this will help. You can clone your existing system onto an SSD or reinstall operating system. Have had failures with cheaper and lesser known brands, have never had a failure (touch wood!) with a Western Digital drive, Small cost premium is well worth the extra quality, You get what you pay for! I have probably fitted 50 SSD drives in last 12 months. All 3 failures were cheaper lesser known brands.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Changed my old hard drive to solid state - best thing I ever did and I should have done it years ago! Easy to copy my old hardrive info onto new one, so didn't even have to go through the rigmarole of loading all my programmes on again. It's quiet and boots up quickly. Btw, I'm no computer whizz, just a PC user... I don't know about anything technical.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Mint!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put - brilliant. Removed from 6 year old laptop the HHD and added this SSD instead. Boot time went from 1min 49secs to 32 secs. Job done and laptop lightning quick. Saved me a ton for new machine and using EaseUS Partition Master, (software) it did a perfect clone from old to new and booted first time. Just need to buy a SATA to USB lead £7. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: II-FlareFire-II

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Life-Changer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go in my mid-2012 model MacBook Pro. I have Mojave installed and, before installation, I was making a cup of tea and drinking it while an app loaded. Installing this drive has transformed my MacBook Pro and given it a new lease of life. In fact, it's quite startling. Was easy to instal, performance in terms of speed is a marked improvement over the old spinning disc and I felt it was great value for storage size -- 500GB.
customer_reviews.author: notjustdad

customer_reviews.title: WESTERN DIGITAL IS A RELIABLE MAKE
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed into my Fractal Design Nano S PC case but may be different result in a laptop or desktop - depends on case design. The novice needs to note that the drive is not plug and play. It probably won't appear in Windows File Explorer. You need to go into settings and search for disk management - it will show there with other drives if any. Select the drive, allocate a drive letter and format. It will help if go to YouTube and search "Windows 10 Disk Management".
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mounsey

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant value - have bought on 2 separate occaisions
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant value drive Have rejuvenated a 8 year old laptop with this drive. Boot time now under 20 seconds from power up. Data transfer speeds are now at full SATA speeds. I'm regularly seeing gigabytes of data transfer in seconds. I run o&o defrag regularly to keep the ssd healthy and suggest you do something similar. Best value performance ssd I could find!
customer_reviews.author: KingCedricTheGreat

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hot
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the product is OK. I am using it to replace an old Toshiba hard disk I had in my also old HP Pavilion dv6-1050us Entertainment Notebook PC. Nevertheless, there is a problem because it is getting too hot. The disk gets super hot after a few hours if I have to compare with the previous one. I don't know if this is normal or not but I'm worried at this time. In addition at this time I cannot see any improvement, time for booting is almost the same, so maybe it was not a good idea to but it, wasn't it?
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS E. RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is used for with no problems. It is the second one I have bought. The first was for my computer which was running really slow. Now it's fast again. No it's faster than it ever was from start up to opening programmes. The second one was for my wife's computer as I was so pleased with the first. That should indicate how pleased I am with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No issues, working as expected
customer_reviews.text: Double the capacity of the equivalent Samsung drive for the price. As a system builder I've exclusively used wd mechanical drives for around 20 years and never had one fail so it's a brand i trust. Admittedly i still pay the extra for Samsung ssd/m.2 drives in my own PC but this was for my niece for a pc i built her for xmas. She's happy so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Chevallier

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD, but watch the price as it changes daily (buy when it's low)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at it's lowest point of just over £109 (the price fluctuates daily!) to replace my current Kingston 120GB SSD, which is getting very low on space. I already have Acronis software, so once I'd downloaded the extras and cloned the one disk to the new WD it booted-up first time without issue. Is slightly faster than my Kingston, and obviously lots more space so a win-win. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: UK Buyer

customer_reviews.title: MY WIN 8.1 STARTS IN A FLASH
customer_reviews.text: Get MiniTool Partition Wizard 11 if you want to clone/migrate your HDD to SSD, I must add that windows will have to restart in to protected mode ie command prompt to complete the cloning/migration, once done remove your old internal HDD and install your new SSD. Remember you have to first connect your SSD to any of your USB ports with a SATA to USB controller.
customer_reviews.author: HPB

customer_reviews.title: For Windows 10 - So fast
customer_reviews.text: I have a fairly old HP EliteDesk 800 which used to work at a reasonable speed. However, the time taken to get a 'ready' Windows 10 machine after reboot was taking over six or seven minutes, sometimes longer. I don't mean icons on the screen, I mean all background processes complete and system ready to run. Using Aconis backup I cloned the drive to one of these SSDs and in less than a minute the machine is ready and very responsive. Most programs load in seconds (3/6 secs) instead on 30-40 for things like Photoshop and InDesign. Seems to be made by Sandisk, but pleased the relatively small investment paid off.
customer_reviews.author: sn2701

customer_reviews.title: Installed on DELL Inspiron 15 5577 Gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Laptop came with a 128GB M.2 SSD + 1 TB Mechanical Drive. Wanted to upgrade to an SSD after seeing how fast applications on the SSD were. Swapped out the 1TB for this 500GB SSD. Windows is installed on the 128 GB SSD while most of the programs and games are installed on this WD 500GB SSD. Barely any load times. Once you go SSD, you can't go back! Drive came with the latest firmware installed. Installation was straightforward - loads of guides online. Does not come with any mounting screws.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: SSDs way to go
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't used an SSD yet get one they are remarkably fast and you will actually notice the difference too, great for operating systems as well as general storage for movies and music etc. Because its so fast OS's will boot so much quicker and movies are more stable and reliable. They are much much lighter than standard HDs too.
customer_reviews.author: Music Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: WD 3D NAND SSD 500gb- 5years limited warranty
customer_reviews.text: 500Gb space after formating and initialization is 465gb on win10. Speed around 540/525 on SATA 3 with 6g. WD SSD utility software works great. WTB: 200TB, 1.75milions hours MTBF and 5years limited warranty. TLC technology. 7mm thin. Absolutely perfect deal with great warranty and durability and i am very happy with it. Used on M4800 with 32gb RAM and i7 quad core 2.9ghz as second ssd drive with three disk drives in total and all works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing SSD cannot be faulted
customer_reviews.text: The SSD by Western digital so we will know that it would be reliable. I've purchased the Blue 500GB replacing Kingston A400 SSD and I can say that this SSD is far more responsive than the other..even though they both have relatively the same read speeds, it's also to do with the response times that make a system feel snappy. I would happily recommend this SSD to anyone for its reliability and speeds.
customer_reviews.author: CAI Po Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to instal and runs so fast now, My OS used to run off an old HDD, which of course made it very slow, I decided to upgrade to an SSD to speed it up. Upon installation and cloning the OS etc. the speed of the computer was amazing, little to no loading times and so much faster. I’d recommend this to everyone for an OS upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Harry B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy fit, speed enhancing, SSD
customer_reviews.text: Just finished installing this SSD into my computer. The installation was a bit of a hassle, mainly because its the first time I've done this so didn't know what I was doing. The results are astounding; the OS loads so much faster, used to take 5-6 minutes, now takes 20-30 seconds; programs load faster, i.e. Outlook, Word, etc; browsers open and load faster, downloads complete faster. I could go on but you get the picture. Cracking piece of kit
customer_reviews.author: Bob Shortis

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should upgrade their PC that has a conventional hard plated hard with this
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should upgrade their PC that has a conventional hard plated hard with this. I should have done this earlier for one of my PC. There are also some good instructional videos on Youtube for the upgrade process of copying your current system hard drive to the new SSD or Reinstalling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goodebye WD20EFRX
customer_reviews.text: I've a number of SSD's in various systems and this one for the price and performance ratio was a no-brainer. I copied my data (mainly TV programmes) from the 2TB WD Red that had been running for seven years and seemed to be getting a bit slow onto a nice 8TB Segate that is connected via USB 3 on my GA-G41MT-USB3 in an Antec Media Center Case. Can't fault it. Used Paragon to copy the partitions over (Mine are separated with OS/Programs on C and User Data on D - Win 7 32 Bit - I know I should upgrade - might get round to it). Booted no problem and saturates my old SATA I controller. I just love SSD's.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggiesden

customer_reviews.title: Good for now :)
customer_reviews.text: It was recommended by the IT staff and purchased accordingly and installed easily It does disappoint that I paid £40 for an external terabyte and this is only half of it and still priced for more but I was advised by the IT staff this is the best option It is working fine but it has been only a few weeks so this isn’t full review Arrived promptly in time and installed Positives thus far but ideally you should check in with me in 2 years to see wether it’s still ok but SSD are normally fine so should t be an issue :)
customer_reviews.author: Fathima

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this drive. Bought out of necessity as my mechanical drive was starting to cause issues. Simple to install, but would recommend getting a mounting cradle as this is just the drive. Nice and fast at loading things like windows, boot time on my machine is now only 20 seconds and ths machine is fully up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Helped me revive my 2010 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Was in desparate need as my 2010 MacBook Pro Hard disk died, did a lot of research and zeroed down on the WD 500 GB SSD Hard Drive. This has impressed me with its performance...I was able to install it without any fuss. Have seen a massive improvement in the boot up speed. Touchwood it has been almost a month and it's working perfectly !!!
customer_reviews.author: shailendra singh

customer_reviews.title: First Class Performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance, easily achieving 500 MB/s read and write speeds as seen in the attached test picture. It took just under 40 minutes to clone 256GB data from my old 3.5 inch HD to this new 2.5 inch SSD. The SSD then booted first time into the cloned Window 10 64 bit operating system with no problems after load up other than my USB mouse not being initially recognised, but soon resolved after swapping USB ports. Buy this product with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John J. Noel

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but made entirely of plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but this is the first SSD I've bought made entirely from plastic. It feels thin and flimsy, and was a bit rattly too. I dare say the undeclared IOPS figures are rather poor too but I was just after the cheapest possible 480GB ssd from a reputable brand. I got what I paid for, and wanted; just beware this is not a high-quality product - it's cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good SSD for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's an SSD at the end of the day, I do not use this as a boot drive but can tell you from experience that this SSD will be quick at booting windows. I use it as a game drive and having 500gb is very helpful. Games boot very fast and help with performance a little. Easy to install. Isn't the fastest out there but for the money this will be adequate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: My daughters laptop is a different machine.
customer_reviews.text: Had already installed the bigger version of this in my desktop machine. So pleased with the increasd boot up times so didn't hesitate to get one installed into my daughters almost dead laptop. This has changed the laptop into a new machine and for very little cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: New life to an ageing laptop
customer_reviews.text: This solid state drive 500GB has replaced the inbuilt 250 GB hard drive in my 10 year old laptop, which was recently upgraded from Windows 7 to 10. The computer was running dead slow after the upgrade, as has been reorted by many other people. With the help of someone who was more savvy on computers, the exchange to the SSD drive has transformed the machine, so that the response time is now very fast. I would recommend anyone who has a problem with performance of their PC to make this exchange and save thecost of a new laptop.
customer_reviews.author: lfrench

customer_reviews.title: Much better performance over old SSD
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this so I thought give it a try. There has been a marked improvement over my old SSD, boot takes a few seconds and file transfers are much easier. Given the price this is a bargain and being WD I feel I can trust the hype and the back up.
customer_reviews.author: Funforus

customer_reviews.title: everything is fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's computer and everything went smoothly. It's well packaged and delivered promptly. Once I got it, I installed the ssd in the computer as the second drive, downloaded a free software to clone the old system disk on this new ssd, then I replaced the old hard disk with this one and that's it. The computer is now much faster.
customer_reviews.author: nailintyre

customer_reviews.title: May not be recognised when fitted!
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, however, there seems to be a common problem with SSD cards not being recognised ater installation. I managed to sort the problem using youtube, took me 5 minutes to sort it out. So make sure you check systems manager to see if it is there before you decide to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M.

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, W10 migration software hit and misz
customer_reviews.text: Easy to physically install. Used as part of a new motherboard/cpu/ram/ssd. Tried to migrate Win10 using software from WD website. Refused to work because it didn't recognize WD drive. Had to download Macrium free instead. Bit of a faff. 5/5 for the drive 1/5 for the software. Stopped working after 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brian-O-Blivion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for Hard Disk Drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the HDD on my PC. I used the DSLRKIT 2.5" SSD to 3.5" SATA Hard Disk Drive HDD Adapter Caddy Tray to install in bay previously occupied by the HDD. Easy to install using existing connection leads. Linux Mint installed happily on this and great improvement in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Ferryman

customer_reviews.title: Decent SSD
customer_reviews.text: If you're not looking for screaming data transfers then this is more than adequate for a fast replacement to your old sata drive. It's a decent name with a decent warranty and will definitely speed things up on your old laptop for example..
customer_reviews.author: lewesian

customer_reviews.title: Fast, large, inexpensive and long warranty. Easy to clone and install
customer_reviews.text: Used on an HP elitedesk 800 mini. Increased the disk space from 128gb to 500gb. Used macrium free to clone the disks, replacing the disk was a 2 minute job. Very fast data transfer speeds, with the wd warranty we have come to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Xicuembo

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to speed up an aging Dell Vostro desktop. Install was easy transferring windows not so. The recovery USB drive did not work reported that the drive was too small. The easy and best way and I cannot believe I am saying this about a Microsoft product download and use Microsoft Media Creation Tool it works. Only had the drive installed just over a week but its just like using a new PC. Others have stated its a budget drive and don't like the plastic case. If it keeps on working as it is doing I will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mark Bramley

customer_reviews.title: Value & Speed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade my wife's 4 year old laptop that was taking minutes to boot up. After cloning the laptop hard drive to the ssd and then installing it the laptop now boots up in under 30 seconds. It has given a new lease off life to the laptop well worth the small investment, delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Muttley

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my 2017 iMac which had a 5400rpm drive. Well the iMac is a new computer after installing this, such a pleasure to use, very fast. It really has made such a difference to my Mac I don’t know why I didn’t install it sooner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: why the question about gaming
customer_reviews.text: The disk works, works, simple connection. The disk works, works, simple connection. Just why the question about gaming? can't this disk be used for photo processing? What "different-thinking" person created this mini product survey? Fire from job.
customer_reviews.author: Wojciech C

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for standard drive
customer_reviews.text: The drive took less than five minues to fit using the standard bracket removed from the old hard drive. Re-installing Windows took very little time compared to a normal hard drive due to the much improved disk performance. The boot time is also much faster than with a regular drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory H Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Performance SSD for great price.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good by a well known and respected brand. Some numbers compared to a Cruical SSD and a Samsung NVMe. Performance is excellent indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Mandyata

customer_reviews.title: Great new 2020Hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I had to take my laptop to my sons (as usual when I get stuck or have problems) and he said (good god your laptop is running at snails pace. He suggested that I immediately went to Amazon on my machine and looked up Western Digital WD Blue 3D NAND internal SSD Hard Drive. This was the best £70+ I have had in a long time It came the next day and the next weekend he fitted it for me. The difference is amazing its as though I have had a super charger fitted. Wished I had had this fitted months ago
customer_reviews.author: Very keen amateur chef

customer_reviews.title: Good for a boot drive and slow computers.
customer_reviews.text: The SSD had no problems and passed the SMART test out of the box, installed Windows 10 Professional with no problems. It is quick, reliant but also more prone to losing data as it is 3D NAND, but it is more cost effective, easily replaceable. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Hamtaro

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade my hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Connected via usb3 to ssd cable used macrium reflect software which has a free version. Cloned my larger 700Gb drive to this ssd drive. Good instructions on YouTube only a couple of steps. Cloned successfully and is now in my laptop as the new C drive.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've bought hundreds of drives over the years (I'm an old computer technician) and it always comes down to Western Digital & Seagate for standard mechanical drives; and Western Digital or Samsung for SSD-type drives. I prefer the Western Digital for the mechanical type but for the SSD-type like the Blue 500GB drive referred to here, either the Samsung or WD work great (I have several of each). Go with the least expensive of the two, they are both high quality drives.
customer_reviews.author: Marty913

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade for old Win 7 machines
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 of these to upgrade old office PCs and milk another year or so out of them. They are Dell Win 7 machines, and now boot in 15-20 seconds vs 2-3 min before. Everything launches quicker, too, and the SSDs give the impression of a much faster computer without having a faster CPU or memory. Within reason. Won't necessarily speed up already running programs. But, for these old ones that only have 4 GB RAM, it should also speed up shuffling data in RAM to the pagefile virtual RAM. I used Macrium Reflect to clone each of the drives, using a USB3 external hard drive case made for quick swapping of drives, in case anybody cares.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gotts

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Info is misleading!
customer_reviews.text: Warranty Info is misleading! On the package and in the manual came with the package, it says the warranty is three years. I bought it because of the five year warranty. Thus, I registered the drive on the web site and it indicates that the warranty is indeed five years. I downloaded the Acronis True Image WD edition from wpc web site and it worked just fine. I have Windows 7 and everything went smoothly. My original drive is 1 TBytes and had a lot of empty spaces. I resized it to less than 500GB from Microsoft Disk Management before running Acronis True Image. Some buyers reported problems using Acronis for Windows 10 though.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudiator

customer_reviews.title: Tried two- One was DOA and one Failed after a month
customer_reviews.text: The first one was DOA. The 2nd one just failed after one month. I really like the speed of the drive after I got the 2nd one and it worked. I was in the middle of a game and it just died. After two of these failed so quickly, I wont's try them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I bought the drive because it was only $350, which is cheap compared to other 2TB drives. Unfortunately, after connecting the drive via the same Sata cable and power source my other SSD uses successfully, my BIOS couldn't detect it, my disk management couldn't, and my WD cloning software. The only explanation was that the drive was dead on arrival. I've sent it back and requested a replacement. I hope this second drive won't also be DOA because that would greatly disappoint me and cause me to return the item for a refund and look elsewhere for a new SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Chris widmer

customer_reviews.title: NO SUPPORT.  No email replies whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY WD BLUE. I just purchased a WD SSD with software to download a image my disk. It did nowork but came up with a message (upgrade to Acronis to replicate the drive). I paid 29.99 & downloaded a file which installed Acronis. Upon executing the program I was asked to enter a previous license. Don't have one. Then I am told I need to pay an additional 49.99 to be able to image my new disk! I downloaded a 'free' program & it replicated perfectly. What a SCAM My Crucial SSD and Software worked perfectly. Go Crucial, it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A. Davis Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy about this review. I bought this to replace a 128 GB Corsair SSD that has been running fine for 5 years. Same mount, power cable, and data cable. Computer didn't even see the drive. Re-installed the Corsair and it worked fine. Tried the Western Digital in a different Computer - same result. It's on it's way back to Amazon. At least the return process is painless.
customer_reviews.author: John Grove

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: This dam thing was as slow as the original HDD and made my PS4 extremely hot. Crashed a few times loading as well. I bought the Samsung 860 EVO and downloaded 200GB in about 3 hours compared to 20 hours with the WD BLUE. Returning this this after i submit this review. EVO is better for PS4 Pro and i hate samsung which is the reason i went with WD first. Crucial makes a very good SSD too.
customer_reviews.author: Shooby

customer_reviews.title: There was something loose inside and after a month it ...
customer_reviews.text: There was something loose inside and after a month it stopping working and being recognized by my rig. This was my second of this model WD SSD, I’ve switched to other brands now.
customer_reviews.author: B.Fried

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - 1TB SDD labeled as 4TB
customer_reviews.text: Beware, people are buying these 4TB SSDs from amazon pulling the labels off and returning a 1TB SSD to get a refund from Amazon instead, I got one from Amazon that the Sticker had obviously been pulled off and replaced on this SSD, the creases and slightly off placement give it away. The SSD was also only 1TB not 4TB, Still waiting on my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not really liking this , 2 weeks, not one computer can read. Pay thee extra for an Evo
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Worst Warranty In the Industry
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as one of my few fails since I did not research prior and believed the company add on the longest warranty. Please understand 500 TBW is NOT good. You can get the industry leading brand SSD (Samsung) with a warranty 5 times that and for less. I am so disappointed I screwed this up. But since it was my mistake, I will keep it. Also, do not expect to get read/write speeds faster than 380mbs.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for about 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This worked for about 2 weeks from installation, fast , but then I started getting crashes and it would not recognize the drive, put the old one back in and it is running again. The Good News is Amazon has replaced this drive. I got the new drive, put the operating system on it and it ran great for 3 weeks, crashed like before, reformatted it and loaded the operating system and it ran great for another 3 weeks. Then Crashed. It is now getting thrown in the trash!! DO NOT BUY THIS !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Protoham

customer_reviews.title: No DRAM on 1TB/2TB versions.
customer_reviews.text: If you want DRAM on the 250GB/500GB version, then great. They have DRAM. There is none on the 1TB/2TB versions according to WD, and that info had to be sought after. If you think the higher price on this SSD equates to a better product, nope. You're just paying for a name. It was chance discovery to find this information out, fortunately within my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good as main boot drive, good as secondary drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive seems only capable of being additional storage. I have done fresh installs on 3 computers recently but using different company ssd and they worked great. This drive is horrible as a main boot drive. If you want it as a second drive it should do the job but there are better drives out there. Samsung 860 and the San disk ultra are much better. I wouldn’t buy this or be tempted like I was from the extra cash back by amazon for buying western digital drives.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This was a disaster which would not erase on a apple MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading a 2010 Apple Mac Pro to a SSD. I first checked compatibility withWD and they stated it was. Using a usb zip to boot off I could not get this to even erase. WD support in India was more than pathetic and gave useless solutions which did not work. I felt I was dealing with a Mickey Mouse company. After spending about 5 hours on this I returned and got a Samsung SSD. The Samsung erased successful and the operating system was installed in a jiffy. Shame on you WD a once great company now makes a awful product.
customer_reviews.author: Gumby

customer_reviews.title: Can't Install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace my C: drive in my computer. The free install software requires at least one of your installed drives is a WD. My only WD drive is the one I bought so the software won't install. I can buy an upgrade for $29.00 but I don't trust it since the free WD version never installed. I installed a different brand of SSD on a different computer effortlessly and I expected the same of WD. It appears I will need to buy a $49.00 program from an outside vendor to install this product. DO NOT NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. THE SUPPORT SOFTWARE IS INADEQUATE.
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: Difference in speed that I could tell. Amazing drive!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, came on time, and increased my boot time by more than half. My 1 terabyte hdd took a long time to boot--also a long time to open applications. After I used clonezilla to clone my original hdd to the new sdd, it booted up so quickly that I couldn't believe it. Now, after I push the on button on my laptop, my login screen comes up instantly (~3 sec). As soon as I put my login info and press the enter button, my Windows desktop appears with all icons--before it would take 3-5 seconds. Is like having a new laptop again! I now enjoy using my 6 years old Asus laptop.
customer_reviews.author: S3adrag0n

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Brand SSD
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to storage brands I have never been let down by WD. The drive works like a champ. The only thing I would have done differently is I would have opted for a 1TB rather than a 500GB. I finally built a new gaming computer after a very long time of console gaming, and it seems like a 'small' game is 25GB and most games are 75GB+ now a days, so don't expect to have more than 4-5 games installed at once on this thing. However, that's not the product issue, but just mine. This would be the perfect size for someone who really only plays 1-2 games at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive performance boost
customer_reviews.text: Now that SSDs have become so affordable, I don’t like to “settle” for HDDs in any of my devices. 500GB is more capacity than I’ll ever need in the old Playstation 3 where I installed this drive, and even without TRIM support in the host OS, it’s unlikely to wear out in my lifetime (not something I could say about the old HDD it replaced). It made a huge improvement in game install/load times, and that’s without 6G transfer speeds. Stick one of these in a modern laptop that *does* support 6G and TRIM—you’ll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua GTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: New life to older PC
customer_reviews.text: Installed this into an older secondary PC in my home which only had very occasional use. (Core 2 Quad 3 GHz based PC). Still wanted to get some performance boost at minimal cost and this did it well. Boot times and disc I/O times improved substantially. This was the only PC in our home (out of 4 desktop PC's and three laptops) that still used physical hard drive as the system drive so it was nice to see the performance increase. I have always relied on Western Digital drives (both HDD and SSD) for reliability. Have never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LaciBacsi

customer_reviews.title: One of the best and only the best
customer_reviews.text: One year has passed by since I've purchased this SSD to be my 13 inch laptop's main boot drive and my first SSD purchase ever and it didn't disappoint me. It made it clear that I will not go back for HDD to be my boot or OS drive EVER. Since the one year I've never had any problems with it, I'm not a heavy data user but here are some details and I'm still on 100% from the Dashboard. 1- Power-On count: 1789. 2-Drive Power Cycle Count : 1193. 3-Total GB Written : 8390. 4-Total GB Read : 7506. 100% Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Bringing Life To My Wife's Beloved Dinosaur PC
customer_reviews.text: My wife is very attached to her dinosaur of a pc. She's had it for nearly a decade and while she wants it to be faster, she doesn't want any changes to be made to it. So... I upgraded the RAM, replaced the battery, and finally replaced the hard drive with this one. It's the fastest it's ever been and she is really impressed with how quickly things load now. Instead of waiting 15 seconds to load a Printable PDF, she can now load it in less than a second. The only thing left to do is figure out how to replace the processor without her knowing it.... Coming Soon!
customer_reviews.author: Zadees

customer_reviews.title: Like Getting A New Laptop
customer_reviews.text: While not terribly old, there was a definite lag in performance with my Laptop. It utilized a 1TB HDD that functions just fine (currently used as second drive now). This WD 1TB SSD is just FAST. My boot-up time is less than 20 seconds. Like getting a new laptop, the performance increase is that quick. While others my run more technical metrics to measure speeds, for the average user, the speed increase is impressive. There was the need to buy a SATA to USB cable and download WD mirroring software, but the process was painless and quickly completed. Great drive at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Denlinger

customer_reviews.title: A little overpriced but I like Western Digital's Reputation! I'm a long time customer
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital's 500GB WD Blue 3D NAND internal SSD is a no brainer for a laptop or PC upgrade. It's somewhat fairly priced but it could be cheaper. This SSD performs well for daily usage, multitasking and data transfer. Acceptable data transfer rates for now, but let’s see if it stands the test of time. This product is not intended for heavy usage or serious gamers, if that's what you're looking for, look elsewhere but for daily computing it serves its purpose!
customer_reviews.author: CyberCache

customer_reviews.title: SSD Failure
customer_reviews.text: K so I was aware that there is a significant operation life for most SSD's. I read that there is probably only 8 to 10 year life on most all SSD drives. I was okay with that especially considering the price, which was 88.99 at the time of purchase (noticed price has gone down even more now!!) This SSD gave me less than a year of operation before going tits up, gee thanks, Wild Blue, all my games and photos gone. Product sucks, don't depend on this piece of junk, maybe a few more customers will be writing in within a year like me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Smith

customer_reviews.title: RE: for an old school cMP1,1 upgraded to the 'hilt' this SSD worked fine out of the box.  BUTT...
customer_reviews.text: You will not realize much improvement overall in daily work, just boot times. Otherwise it was as described, easy to install, and it does work. I'd recommend it at 1/2 the current price (4/1/2020) with 5 stars, but honestly it is not worth the upgrade price compared to nearly FREE 1 TB HDs that folks are literally tossing out (with their personal images, data, and passwords on a daily basis). So, consider just being patient during a boot cycle, and otherwise go with an OLD OLD OLD school HDD instead of a SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dave Osbourne

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all mac users.
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with my mac mini (late 2014) for almost a year now. As a creative professional, it's important for me to have Photoshop, Lightroom, my e-mail, spotify, etc, etc open all at the same time and this SSD has completely resolved all of my crashing and spinning wheel issues. My computer boots 30x faster and so do my programs. Completing the installation process wasn't so bad. I used IFixIt.com and typed in my mac mini model to find instructions. When dissecting your mac mini, I would recommend that you label the screws for so that you don't get confused when you're putting everything back together. Highly recommended for anyone wishing to give their mac a new life!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TylerL

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for your mechanical hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: Dell inspiron laptop was taking 3-5 minutes & sometimes longer to boot. Opening documents & spreadsheets was painfully slow. Google Chrome very slow. Traced it down to disk I/O pretty much pegged at 100%. I tried all the Windows tricks to reduce hard drive use pretty much disabling everything. Got frustrated and bough this drive. Installation was easy. Now the laptop cold-boots in under 20 seconds. Everything opens within seconds and disk I/O rarely goes above 5%. If your system is slow and you have a mechanical hard drive this is probably your answer.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry from Pennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: Brand Name SSD, 5yr Warranty, and downloadable imaging/cloning software.
customer_reviews.text: Name Brand, 5yr Warranty, Imaging/cloning software that can resize a larger drive with larger partitions to fit onto a smaller SSD, that is if you're total data use is still less the drive purchased. (ie 1TB spinning drive with only 128GB used will be migrated to the 250GB, with the drive space automatically resized.) It's SATA 3 with RW speeds in the 500MB/s range, really though going from a spinning drive to SSD will yield huge improvements any way you look at it.
customer_reviews.author: fishing guy

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure it works
customer_reviews.text: I was late to returning this so I decided to install it into my computer since I missed the window. I purchased to upgrade my older model computer with a better SSD card, but decided to purchase a newer computer shortly after. I installed this in my new computer as a secondary and I have not been able to get it to recognize it's installed. I"m not sure if it was damaged or if I have missed a step but my newer HP desktop computer does not see it as hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Really Fast
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my 2012 Mac Mini and it replaced the original 5400 RPM stock drive. It was running Mojave on the original drive and I installed Mojave on the SSD as well. Programs open a little quicker but the overall response has improved. No more spinning beachballs. Boot Times From The Power Button to sign in password Boot times HDD 5400 RPM = 1m and 13 secs Boot times SSD = 18.58 secs.
customer_reviews.author: Rodster

customer_reviews.title: Trust Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: Summary: For this creative professional moving 100 gig video files these drives are reliable and fast PROS: Fast, and reliable from a proven industry leader CONS: None. I tried SanDIsk, Samsung and other SSD and this is one of my favorites. It's from Western Digital and I've not had a drive failed on me yet: I have their 3.5 Red, black and Green internal drives in 2, 4 and 8 terabytes and now I have their 2.5 Blues for the mobile video production. These drives are fast and reliable. The price is reasonable and cheaper than Samsung. Western Digital has a proven track record that keeps me coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon W.

customer_reviews.title: It works...it's slow
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but benchmarks say it's not very fast...sequential read speeds in the low 200s. But if you don't need cutting edge speed, it's a good value. So far, it's a good 3-star item.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Neil

customer_reviews.title: Used WD SSD instead of Samsung 850 EVO. Just as fast as Samsung.
customer_reviews.text: 5 WD SSD used in the last 6 months. Previously used Samsung 850 EVO and PRO. New Samsung 860 model do not have 10 year warranty, just 5. I have used three 256 Gig, one 512 Gig and one 1TGig to replace mechanical hard drive in 5 PCs.All worked with any problems. These are TLC memory cells, if you want better memory, use Samsung 860 PRO, it uses MLC cell memory.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Praniewicz

customer_reviews.title: it might be good ssd but software sucks
customer_reviews.text: It maybe good ssd but cloning software it comes with just sucks, I tried both automatic & manual cloning, both ways I get left with over 226gb partition that I don't want that I can't delete or format. 1 star for only be able use half the total ssd space. I can't even return it since it won't allow me format half the ssd, meaning my personal information will in the hands of ppl I don't know or trust.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in a desktop to add some extra storage space. The drive is very fast and easy to install. With the large storage space it gives me plenty of room for all my music and photos. When installing the drive in a desktop make sure that your desktop has a bay that will accept this size drive. If it does not you can order an adapter from Amazon that will hold this drive and fit in a standard drive bay in the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: T. Runyan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy this SSD if you are trying to clone an existing HDD on a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have swapped HDD's before and built PCs. I am not a novice. However, the solution WD has which is to download the free version of Acronis and use it, along with a USB 3.0 cable to clone your HDD does not work. See the error message in the image I attached. I am on my 4th chat and 2nd phone call of the day with WD. I have wasted nearly 6 HOURS trying to get to someone who just needed to install a 'patch'!!! Terrible situation....
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ssd because it was one of the cheapest on the market at the time. I should have known it would not last. 6 months down the road I am getting constant crashes and blue screens. Honestly, I believe any ssd should last longer than this. You get what you pay for I guess...
customer_reviews.author: Josiah s

customer_reviews.title: Performance Enhancing Upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: SSD is probably the best upgrade you could perform if you have an older computer or budget unit with a mechanical hard drive. Performance improvement is immediate and it can breathe new life into a lagging machine. That being said, it's not going to transform your machine into a gaming powerhouse. It will just maximize the efficiency of everyday tasks and improve the performance of things a lot of users do with their PC. Replacing the HD can be a complex task on some computers so look at some You Tube videos to make sure you can install it yourself. Not many upgrades give you so much bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reading/Writing In The Blink Of An Eye
customer_reviews.text: I have a WD NVMe setup on my ASROCK Steel Legend Mobo as the C drive to run Windows 10 Pro, a WD M.2 3D NAND to backup the NVMe, another WD M.2 3D NAND, (6) of these 3D NAND SSDs with (1) WD 7200 RPM Blue HDD. These 3D NAND read, write, upload, and download in the blink of an eye. I downloaded a 3.8Gb video to one of the 3D NAND SSD in 37 seconds. I downloaded the same video to the 7200 RPM HDD in about 7 minutes 42 seconds. I use nothing but Western Digital drives in my computers because they are always of the highest quality and they have never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Gomez Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy PC upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out a 500GB with this one for speed. 500GB is now my rotating (re-clone every 30 days) system-backup. Being a different size did create a challenge; there's a lot of software that just won't do the job. Mini-Partition software works great and is free but WD's own won't work unless the drives' sizes match. Hardest part was coordinating BIOS and Windows disk management but if you take your time it will really show in the end. Very impressed with the physical product itself. I've been buying and using WD since my first PC (a 8088 with a 20MB drive) so you know how long I've been working on PC's.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and happy in Virginia

product_meta.title: Western Digital 500GB WD Blue 3D NAND Internal PC SSD - SATA III 6 Gb/s, 2.5"/7mm, Up to 560 MB/s - WDS500G2B0A
product_meta.description: Capacity:500GBThe WD Blue 3D NAND SATA SSD utilizes 3D NAND technology for capacities up to 4TB with enhanced reliability. Featuring an active power draw up to 25% lower than previous generations of WD Blue SSDs, you’re able to work longer before recharging your laptop, while sequential read speeds up to 560MB/s and sequential write speeds up to 530MB/s give the speed you want for your most demanding computing applications. Combined with the free, downloadable WD SSD Dashboard software and a 5-year limited warranty, you can confidently upgrade your system to the WD Blue 3D NAND SATA SSD. |As used for storage capacity, one terabyte (TB) = one trillion bytes. Total accessible capacity varies depending on operating environment. | Active power draws are up to 25% lower during sequential reads than previous generations of WD Blue SSD at the 500GB capacity point. | As used for transfer rate or interface, megabyte per second (MB/s) = one million bytes per second and gigabit per second (Gb/s) = one billion bits per second.
feature_bullets: Sequential read speeds up to 560MB/s and sequential write speeds up to 530MB/seconds; As used for transfer rate or interface, megabyte per second (MB/s) = one million bytes per second and gigabit per second (Gb/s) = one billion bits per second

An industryleading 1.75M hrs mean time to failure (MTTF) and up to 500 TBs written (TBW) for enhanced reliability; MTTF based on internal testing using Telcordia stress part testing; TBW calculated using Jedec client workload (JESD219)
WD F.I.T. Lab certification for compatibility with a wide range of computers
Free downloadable software to monitor the status of your drive and clone a drive, or backup your data
An active power draw up to 25% lower than previous generations of WD Blue SSD

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars15,657 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
